page.title: 12EDUCATION:SCHOOL AND COLLEGE
page.content: The Stoke-on-Trent sixth form college at Fenton,was opened in 1970 by Harold Wilson,then Prime Minister.It caters for over eleven hundred students with a comprehensive range of A and O level subjects offered. There are many extra- curricular activities too,providing for a wide range of sports and interests. Primary and secondary education has been reorganised in the city. Falling school rolls may be accelerated by urban change.On Leek Road there is a school which has been closed down.Near it old peoples bungalows have replaced terraced homes which had housed young families.The crossing warden used to see over eighty children across the road here - now she only has about sixteen. Part of the North Staffs Polytechnic falls within our area,some of its courses reflect local skills and industries.
